requirement_tested: A frontend application with multiple pages: base, ranking, store, train, workers, upgrades, bank, messages, and reports
user_persona: A new player exploring the game interface for the first time.
user_goal: Navigate to each major section of the game to understand its features.

narrative_steps.title: Starting at Base Page
narrative_steps.description: Alex logs in and lands on the base page. He notices a navigation bar with several options.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Ranking' link in the navigation bar.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The browser navigates to the /ranking page displaying the leaderboard.

narrative_steps.title: Exploring Different Sections
narrative_steps.description: From the ranking page, Alex wants to check out the store next.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Store' link in the navigation bar.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The browser loads the /store page showing available items for purchase.

narrative_steps.title: Continuing Navigation
narrative_steps.description: Curious about military options, Alex moves to the train page.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Train' link in the navigation bar.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The browser displays the /train page with soldier recruitment options.

narrative_steps.title: Visiting All Pages
narrative_steps.description: Alex continues navigating through all available sections to familiarize himself with the game.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Each click loads the corresponding page (/workers, /upgrades, /bank, /messages, /reports) without errors.

requirement_tested: A page for players to select from four races: Humans, Dragonborns, Elves, and Dwarfs, each with unique attributes
user_persona: A new player ready to start playing but hasn't chosen a race yet.
user_goal: Select a race to begin the game with appropriate starting bonuses.

narrative_steps.title: Race Selection Screen
narrative_steps.description: Jordan sees the race selection screen with four distinct race cards on a seashell background.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The Elves race is selected, and Jordan's player profile is initialized with Elf-specific attributes.

requirement_tested: A resource management system displaying gold, iron, wood, and wheat quantities
user_persona: An active player managing resources during gameplay.
user_goal: Monitor resource levels to make informed decisions about upgrades and purchases.

narrative_steps.title: Checking Resource Levels
narrative_steps.description: Taylor looks at the top of the screen to see how much of each resource they have.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The header shows accurate icons and numeric values for current Gold, Iron, Wood, and Wheat quantities.

requirement_tested: A city upgrade system allowing players to enhance their base infrastructure
user_persona: A player looking to strengthen their city defenses and capabilities.
user_goal: Purchase a city upgrade to improve base infrastructure.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Available Upgrades
narrative_steps.description: Morgan navigates to the upgrades page and sees a grid of available city improvements.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Reinforced Walls' upgrade option.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The system validates Morgan's resources and applies the upgrade, reducing resource counts accordingly.

requirement_tested: A worker management page to assign and upgrade workers
user_persona: A player wanting to optimize resource production.
user_goal: Assign more workers to increase resource generation rates.

narrative_steps.title: Managing Workers
narrative_steps.description: Casey goes to the workers page and sees the dual-panel view for worker assignment.
narrative_steps.action: Click the '+' button next to 'Miners' to assign one additional worker.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The number of assigned miners increases by one, and the required resources are deducted from Casey's inventory.

requirement_tested: A military training page to recruit and upgrade soldiers
user_persona: A player preparing for upcoming battles.
user_goal: Recruit new soldiers to build up their army.

narrative_steps.title: Training Soldiers
narrative_steps.description: Riley visits the train page and views the tabbed interface for soldier types.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The system validates Riley's resources and adds the recruited Swordsmen to their trained soldiers count.

requirement_tested: A store interface for purchasing resources, items or upgrades
user_persona: A player needing quick access to resources.
user_goal: Buy additional gold to fund upcoming purchases.

narrative_steps.title: Purchasing Items
narrative_steps.description: Quinn browses the store and finds a bundle of gold for sale.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Buy' button for the 'Gold Bundle'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Gold is deducted from Quinn's balance and the purchased gold amount is added to their inventory.

requirement_tested: A banking system for managing resource storage and interest
user_persona: A player wanting to safely store excess gold and earn interest.
user_goal: Deposit gold into the bank to earn passive income.

narrative_steps.title: Depositing Gold
narrative_steps.description: Pat goes to the bank page and sees the dashboard panel with banking options.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Deposit' button and enter an amount of gold.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The specified gold amount is transferred from Pat's inventory to their bank account, increasing stored gold balance.

requirement_tested: A messaging system for player communication
user_persona: A social player wanting to communicate with friends in-game.
user_goal: Read a received message from another player.

narrative_steps.title: Reading Messages
narrative_steps.description: Alex checks their inbox and sees a new message notification.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the unread message thread.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The detailed message exchange opens, showing the conversation history between Alex and the sender.

requirement_tested: A battle system enabling players to engage in combat with others
user_persona: A competitive player seeking to prove their strength.
user_goal: Initiate a battle against another player.

narrative_steps.title: Starting a Battle
narrative_steps.description: Sam goes to the battle initiation screen and selects an opponent.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A match request is queued, and upon resolution, Sam is redirected to a results screen showing the battle outcome and any rewards earned.

requirement_tested: A ranking page displaying player scores and positions
user_persona: A competitive player tracking their progress against others.
user_goal: Check their current position on the global leaderboard.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Rankings
narrative_steps.description: Jordan navigates to the ranking page to see how they compare to other players.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A leaderboard table displays top-ranked players with usernames, scores, and ranks, highlighting Jordan's position.

requirement_tested: A reports page showing historical activity and battle outcomes
user_persona: A strategic player reviewing past actions for future planning.
user_goal: Review previous battle outcomes to adjust strategy.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Activity Logs
narrative_steps.description: Morgan visits the reports page to see a chronological feed of past events.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a specific battle entry to expand details.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Extended details about the selected battle, including involved entities and exact resource changes, are revealed.

requirement_tested: A backend API to serve dynamic game data to the frontend
user_persona: A developer testing the integration between frontend and backend systems.
user_goal: Verify that the frontend can retrieve dynamic player data from the backend.

narrative_steps.title: Fetching Player Data
narrative_steps.description: The frontend makes a request to get the current player's information.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The backend returns structured player data including profile info, resources, and current status in JSON format.

requirement_tested: A PostgreSQL database connection configured with specified environment variables
user_persona: A system administrator setting up the game server.
user_goal: Ensure the backend can connect to the PostgreSQL database using correct credentials.

narrative_steps.title: Database Connection Test
narrative_steps.description: The backend service attempts to establish a connection to the PostgreSQL database.
narrative_steps.action: Start the backend server with environment variables set.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The backend successfully connects to the PostgreSQL database at localhost:5432 using myappuser/myapppassword credentials.

requirement_tested: A package.json configuration enabling `npm run install:all` and `npm run dev` commands
user_persona: A developer setting up the project for local development.
user_goal: Install dependencies and start both frontend and backend servers simultaneously.

narrative_steps.title: Installing Dependencies
narrative_steps.description: The developer runs the unified installation script to prepare the development environment.
narrative_steps.action: Run `npm run install:all` in the root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both frontend and backend dependencies are installed successfully without errors.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Development Servers
narrative_steps.description: After installation, the developer starts both development servers with one command.
narrative_steps.action: Run `npm run dev` in the root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Concurrent processes start the frontend and backend development servers, making them accessible locally.
